title: (x) Arabic style "M.A.R.occan nights" theme party script - various similar {gang}
content:
Hi. Can anyone identify this font? Also, if you have any suggestions for this style of type and font pairings for a chic theme party. I want it to look sophisticated, but have to present some ideas with more of a Moroccan flare. Ideas? Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [maroccan\_nights\_2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120104180016/http:/typophile.com/files/maroccan_nights_2.jpg) | 63.29 KB |
author: gigi3206

comments.content: The script is either Typo Upright or Linoscript...
Sorry, I meant the font that says MARoccan Nights.
I figured that was what you were looking for. Couldn't find it on myfonts or dafont. Sorry.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/ondine/morelikethis.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20120104180016/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/ondine/morelikethis.html "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/ondine/morelikethis.html")

Ondine or something along those lines might be good, there was a band graphic with a very similar script identified here about 4(?) months ago, maybe someone with a better memory than me will remember it.  
Tim

You could search for Arabic and for Arabian at myfonts and dafont but your font doesn't come up.

I have a font called "arabia" which is similar but not a match. It's from fontographer so not available. Another one is called Aladdin, but I can't find it either.

[Legende](http://web.archive.org/web/20120104180016/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/legende/) is the commercial brother of [Aladdin](http://web.archive.org/web/20120104180016/http:/www.dafont.com/aladdin.font). But both are just similar ...

['Quiller'](http://web.archive.org/web/20120104180016/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/quiller/) from Canada Type (a revival of 'Privat' by Joachim Siercke) has alternate characters that have a similar flare, and could make a good substitute if the original can't be found. I have a feeling this might be a font from Scriptorium -- at least I think it looks familiar. Still checking Part 4 of the Script Guide...

- Mike Yanega

I think the Scriptorium font I was thinking of was 'Serendib'. He also has 'Caliph', which is a version of Legende/Aladdin.

Other fonts are 'Pide Nashi' (Linotype), and Judith Sutcliffe's 'Arabia' set, with a variety of pseudo-Arabic fonts.

- Mike Yanega

It's probably too late, but the font that, to me, most resembles the sample is [Khayyam](http://web.archive.org/web/20120104180016/http:/www.roostertypes.com/view_fullfont.asp?catalogid=19836&issingle=yes).
